p:
Next, we analysed the major CHIKV lineages shown in
Fig 2 separately using a Bayesian coalescence approach to estimate the evolutionary rate and the time to the most recent common ancestor (tMRCA) of each lineage. We initially assessed the evolutionary signal of the alignments using root-to-tip regression estimates (
S1 Fig ). We then analysed the Asian all, Asian old, non-IOL ECSA, IOL and WAf datasets, which had strong evolutionary signals ( R
2 >0.63 for all datasets); the Asian sequences sampled post 1995 had a poor evolutionary signal ( R
2 = 0.15) and were not analysed (
S1 Fig ).
